scriptmanager.scripts.Coordinate_Manipulation

Class ShiftCoord

  • java.lang.Object
    • scriptmanager.scripts.Coordinate_Manipulation.ShiftCoord

  • public class ShiftCoord
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains scripts for shifting coordinate intervals (BED/GFF) by a user-defined direction and distance.
    Author:
    Olivia Lang
    See Also:
    ShiftCoordCLI, ShiftIntervalWindow

        public ShiftCoord()

    • Method Detail

      • shiftBEDInterval

        public static void shiftBEDInterval(java.io.File out_filepath,
                                    java.io.File input,
                                    int SHIFT,
                                    boolean stranded,
                                    boolean gzOutput)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Shift BED-formatted intervals by a user-defined direction and distance. Includes Gzip support.
        Parameters:
        out_filepath - Filepath to save shifted BED-formatted files. If null, outputs to STDOUT.
        input - Filepath to starting BED-formatted coordinates we want to shift. Supports automatic detection and handling of GZipped BED-formatted files. Must have at least 3 tab-delimited columns per BED specifications.
        SHIFT - Integer value indicating number and direction of nucleotides to shift the entire intervals (negative values are upstream shifts while positive values are downstream shifts)
        stranded - If this is true, then the stranded-ness of features is taken into account for the directionality of the shift. Otherwise all upstream shifts move intervals to the left and all downstream shifts move to the right with respect to the reference.
        gzOutput - If this is true, the output file will be gzipped.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • shiftGFFInterval

        public static void shiftGFFInterval(java.io.File out_filepath,
                                    java.io.File input,
                                    int SHIFT,
                                    boolean stranded,
                                    boolean gzOutput)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Shift GFF-formatted intervals by a user-defined direction and distance. Includes Gzip support.
        Parameters:
        out_filepath - Filepath to save shifted GFF-formatted files. If null, outputs to STDOUT.
        input - Filepath to starting GFF-formatted coordinates we want to shift. Supports automatic detection and handling of GZipped GFF-formatted files. Must have exactly 9 tab-delimited columns per GFF specifications.
        SHIFT - Integer value indicating number and direction of nucleotides to shift the entire intervals (negative values are upstream shifts while positive values are downstream shifts)
        stranded - If this is true, then the stranded-ness of features is taken into account for the directionality of the shift. Otherwise all upstream shifts move intervals to the left and all downstream shifts move to the right with respect to the reference.
        gzOutput - If this is true, the output file will be gzipped.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
